result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Allen Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Allen Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Allen Anderson was found guilty of Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Michael Allen Anderson was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Jury trial on August 1, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Motion hearing on June 26, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael Allen Anderson in court with attorney Kara Rolf.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes this is a continued hearing and notes he believes the State was checking w/availability of witnesses for scheduling of trial.  State has dates they are unavailable.  Atty Rolf notes she has additional issues re: docs needed re: witnesses and those were due 1/18/2017 and she hasn't rec'd anything yet.  State responds.  Parties argue re: possible curriculum vitae.  State is unsure doctor has a curriculum vitae or not but would ask and then forward to Atty Rolf.  CV's (if any) and criminal histories to be provided to opposing counsel no later than 2/20/2017.  Motions addressed today.  State calls Det. Justin Hannigan - SCSD - S&T.  Exhibit #1 marked and ID'd.  Court receives #1.  Parties discuss report just provided to Atty Rolf today.  Court won't go any further into it.  Atty Rolf does cross-exam.  Atty Rolf shows officer a page of his report for his review.  Witness excused.  Nothing further from the State and Atty Rolf has no witnesses.  State reserves argument.  Atty Rolf rests on the record on her original motion to suppress hearings and withdraws claim as to 11/18/2015 claim due to new reports provided today.  State responds/believes all statements should be admissible.  Atty Rolf continues to rest.  Court takes recess to make his decision.  Back on the record, the Court addresses the one motion remainging re: suppressing statements.  Court finds DE was not in custody so no Miranda warnings were necessary so statement may be admitted.  Motion is denied.

on motion hearing 12/21/16
Cover Letter from atty. Hoffman

Motion hearing on February 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on February 7, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Michael Allen Anderson in court with attorney Kara Rolf.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes they are not going to consider the motion to suppress this morning but will address all other motions filed.  State has filed motion in limine and Court will take that up first.  Atty Rolf states what she wants to address re: "beating stick".  State responds.  Parties are in agreement.  Atty Rolf address prison sentence of Mr. Fore but since he's not on the State's witness list it wouldn't be an issue.  State isn't planning on calling him but if they do they have no objection to the prior convictions questions.  Court notes that can be addressed should he be called.  Court addresses alcohol or drug use issue.  Atty Rolf responds re: if person was using around the time of the offense.  State is in agreement.  Court asks State draft order stating the agreements here today so they have a record of it.  Atty Rolf addresses prior other acts and request from Court that DE not make mention of potential penalties.  Atty Rolf requests deadline from the Court as to witness list as she's still looking into possibly hiring an expert.  Court requests final witness list finalization date.  Atty Rolf states she can have hers in by 1/12/2017.  State responds/doesn't think two weeks is enough for the State to respond to expert testimony.  Court orders parties to provide witness lists by 1/12/2017 and that should include any experts you intend to call.  If there is any problem w/that then there would need to be a separate motion for leave.  That completes motions in limine by the State.  State to prepare order as such for the Court's signature.  State addresses requests.  Evidence - State will not be producing recordings of interviews so nothing necessary.  Atty Rolf is in agreement.  State addresses other acts evidence.  Parties in agreement.  Atty Rolf requests lab reports of any testing done.  State will provide it if they have one.    Atty Rolf requests any exhibits be provided and at this time the DE is not planning on submitting any exhibits but if they decide they are going to that they will provide it to the State.  State is in agreement.  Atty Rolf addresses other acts.  State responds/they do not intend to produce other acts evidence.  Parties discuss.  Court orders witnesses be informed they not volunteer any information that is not responsive to the question asked.  Atty Rolf notes no curriculum vitae provided for some of the witnesses on the State's list.  State will provide those if they exist.  Atty Rolf is in agreement.  She also has not received criminal history's on any of the witnesses endorsed either.  State will provide that for their witnesses.  Atty Rolf questions re: procedure in Sauk Co re: exhibits and witness lists.  Court orders that parties exchange witness lists and exhibits intended by 2/1/2017.  State objects.  Court addresses late requests for continuance due to late notice of witnesses and/or exhibits.  State responds.  Court orders good faith witness/exhibit lists be submitted by 2/6/2017.  Atty Rolf has further questions for the Court re: procedures for jury trials here.  Court advises they will take that up at the FPT.  Court is in recess.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 7, 2017 at 02:00 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Allen Anderson appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Adam Raabe. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant recv'd and waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representation.  State requests $500 Cash.  Atty. Raabe makes argument.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived. Court sets $2000.00 Signature bond.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/RF, NF or DP or their residences; Absolute Sobriety; May get belongings w/sheriff's dept. w/prior notice.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:45 am.  Return date scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
